intro: Cyphostemma seitzianum, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, followed by distinctive, spiral-shaped fruits. It thrives in warm, arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
